page.title: 18Bristol Zoo Annexe Patchway.
page.content: The Hollywood Tower Estate was formerly owned by Lady White, wife of the founder of the Bristol Aeroplane Company. On her death it was bought by the Bristol Zoological Society. It is some 100 acres in extent, and is used to provide extra room. Here, in the quiet of the countryside, rare species, such as lemurs, marmosets, okapi and white tigers are bred in special enclosures During the winter species such as the llama are overwintered. Surplus animals are also kept here. The land is farmed to produce food for the Zoo. Carrots, hay, straw, wheat, barley and kale are some of the crops grown. There is also a nursery producing bedding plants for the floral displays. Soft fruits are also produced for birds, animals and the public.
